en.value: The term &#39;multitasking&#39; means:
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions / complete the statements that follow by choosing the most appropriate options out of the given ones.

1. The term 'multitasking' originated as computer jargon for the situations when the central processing unit switches back and forth between different programs. While the human capacity for simultaneously handling multiple tasks has been discussed and studied for centuries, the book is far from closed on how well we can or can't do it

2. Let us look at a fairly common workplace scenario: writing an email to one colleague, while talking on the phone to another. As you are talking, you have temporarily put the skills needed to type (spelling, grammar, manipulating your fingers across the keyboard) on hold. When you turn your attention back to the computer, you then suspend the etiquette of conversation (which may leave your co-worker to ask, "Are you still there?"). So we are not really doing these things simultaneously. "It looks like multitasking is not taking place. We do one task, then we do another," says Pierre Jolicoeur, the research Chairperson in Experimental Cognitive Science at the University of Montreal, Canada, who studies how the human brain handles multiple tasks. "Task switching" is probably a more accurate description, and though the switch may occur in a fraction of second, there is an associated task-switch cost, the amount of time lost with each switch.

3. "As we try to do more and more things in less and less time," often error creeps in, we call that a speed accuracy trade-off", says Jolicoeur.

options.value: a skill to do a number of different tasks simultaneously.
a skill investing money in different profitable shares.
a job in which you are posted at different stations.
difficulty faced by an individual in moving from one task to another simultaneously.

en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions / complete the statements that follow by choosing the most appropriate options out of the given ones.

1. The term 'multitasking' originated as computer jargon for the situations when the central processing unit switches back and forth between different programs. While the human capacity for simultaneously handling multiple tasks has been discussed and studied for centuries, the book is far from closed on how well we can or can't do it

2. Let us look at a fairly common workplace scenario: writing an email to one colleague, while talking on the phone to another. As you are talking, you have temporarily put the skills needed to type (spelling, grammar, manipulating your fingers across the keyboard) on hold. When you turn your attention back to the computer, you then suspend the etiquette of conversation (which may leave your co-worker to ask, "Are you still there?"). So we are not really doing these things simultaneously. "It looks like multitasking is not taking place. We do one task, then we do another," says Pierre Jolicoeur, the research Chairperson in Experimental Cognitive Science at the University of Montreal, Canada, who studies how the human brain handles multiple tasks. "Task switching" is probably a more accurate description, and though the switch may occur in a fraction of second, there is an associated task-switch cost, the amount of time lost with each switch.

3. "As we try to do more and more things in less and less time," often error creeps in, we call that a speed accuracy trade-off", says Jolicoeur.

options.value: doing many different tasks within a very short span of time.
accomplishing many different tasks within a very short span of time.
many people working on a particular task simultaneously.
doing one task and then another almost immediately.

en.value: <span style="">Who is Baraj?</span>
en.comp:
Read the extract given below and answer the questions / complete the statements that follow by choosing the most appropriate options out of the given ones.

Baraj says with hands clasped, Master our days are gone-

New men have come now, new styles and customs in the world.

Don't ask anyone to listen to me now, I beg you at your feet, my lord.

The singer alone does not make a song, there has to be someone who hears:

One man opens his throat to sing, the other sings in his mind 

Only when waves fall in the shore, do they make a harmonious sound.

Only when breezes shake the woods do we hear a rustling in the leaves.

Only from a marriage of two forces does music arise in the world.

en.value: Why Maharana Pratap was regarded as an immortal personality?
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions / complete the statements that follow by choosing the most appropriate options out of the given ones:

1. Maharana Pratap ruled over Mewar only for 25 years. However, he accomplished so much grandeur during his reign that his glory surpassed the boundaries of countries and time turned him into an immortal personality. He along with his kingdom become a synonym for valour, sacrifice and patriotism. Mewar had been a leading Rajput kingdom even before Maharana Pratap occupied the throne. Kings of Mewar, with the cooperation of their nobles and subjects, had established such traditions in the kingdom, as augmented their magnificence despite the hurdles of having a smaller area under their command and less population.

2. There did come a few thorny occasions when the flag of the kingdom seemed sliding down. Their flag once again heaved high in the sky thanks to the gallantry and brilliance of the people of Mewar. This glorious traditions of the kingdom almost continued for 500 years since its establishment, right from the reign of Bappa Rawal. In fact only 60 years before Maharana Pratap, Rana Sanga drove the kingdom to the pinnacle of fame. His reputation went beyond Rajasthan and reached Delhi. Two generations before him, Rana Kumbha had given a new stature of the kingdom through victories and development work.

3. The life of the people of Mewar must have been peaceful and prosperous during the long span of time; otherwise such accomplishments would not have been possible. The ambience of Mewar remains lovely thanks to the cheerful and liberal character of its people.

options.value: <span style="">he added a lot of grandeur to Mewar</span>

en.value: The panther operates <u>in the reverse gear</u> means that:
en.comp:
Read the passage given below and answer the questions / complete the statements that follow by choosing the most appropriate options out of the given ones:

Not unoften, therefore, the panther operated in the reverse gear. That is, instead of stalking upto the animals it lets them come upto it. The modus operandi adopted consists of quietly slinking at dusk into a bush somewhere in the middle of a vast grazing ground where game animals congregate in the evenings and graze throughout the night. In its hideout, the panther waits patiently in the fond hope of some unwary animal passing within its striking distance. Once in a while, when its luck is in, it makes a kill. But, unusually night after night it must watch scores of animals grazing all round, so tantalizingly near yet so distressingly far.

Another artifice adopted by the panther consists in its climbing onto a tree with large leafy crown and use it as its ambush. This arboreal position of the panther is more common in African veldts and savannahs, where good ground cover is more difficult to come by than in the Indian jungles. Its high perch effectively insulates the panther against the prying eyes of game so used to sensing danger around them that they seldom look for it on the treetops. Seated high in the sky the panther pounces upon an unsuspecting victim that may happen to pass underneath. Panthers sitting among leafy branches high up in trees take little notice of passers-by. Their stance gives them the feeling of being invisible. Often they will choose a tree with some sort of berries that attract game animals underneath.
